channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Block cleaning, 1st October
item.description:
Block 36 - 46 Swinburne Court, block has not been cleaned fir 4 weeks now. Lift is dirty and needs mopping, stairway needs to be swept and mopped also.

item.title: Overhanging lower branches are a hazard to pedestrians, particularly the elderly and those with impaired vision, 1st October
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Bins Not Emptied for Months – Fly-Tipping Issue, 1st October
item.description:
The two large bins located near Alfred Salter School’s back door haven’t been emptied in months. They contain mixed refuse, and people have now also dumped additional waste in front of them, as shown in the picture. Since the bins haven’t been cleared for months, the area is becoming a fly-tipping spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full of bricks dumped on disabled property drive, 1st October
item.description:
This is a disabled access property, somebody has left a bin full of bricks on my drive way which can not be moved. I am a disabled resident I can not get into my vehicle as required leaving me stuck in my property as it’s my only means of transport, this is also blocking access to me if required by medical professionals if I need them in an emergency. I need this moved please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chairs can back on to pavement too much - obstruction for prams, wheelchairs, 1st October
item.description:
There are too many tables at cafe on pavement and alignment has been changed from chairs parallel to shop front to one chair with back to shop front, & one back to road. If chair with back to road is pulled out & sat on it restricts available pavement for wheelchair users & pedestrians. Please return to less tables and just two chairs parallel & not one backing toward the road!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 1st October
item.description:
In thomes lane se6 4RQ next to the us stand there are six black bags blocking Tesco fire exit doors can they be removed soon as possible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Catford Broadway, Ladywell, London

item.title: Abandoned building, 1st October
item.description:
The former King’s Head pub building is abandoned. In the back there is a temp shelter for the homeless, the roof is leaking and greens are growing on all sides of the building, there are animals and pests coming and going at all hours.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Vandalised and removed bench, 1st October
item.description:
This is the bench of my friend who died in 2000. The bench has now been removed after it was deemed unfit for repair. I want to replace it in the same place. No one contacted us that the bench was about to be removed and if what we wanted to do about replacing it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Always rubbish, 1st October
item.description:

item.title: Dog fouling on park terrace tudway road, 1st October
item.description:
I am writing to raise serious concerns about the ongoing problem of dog fouling in Kidbrooke. This has been an issue for well over a year now, and it continues to have a negative impact on the community. Many dog walkers in the area are acting carelessly, allowing their dogs to foul on pavements, streets, and green spaces without cleaning up after them. Unfortunately, some appear to have no regard for the health, safety, and wellbeing of other residents. This behaviour is not only unpleasant but also poses genuine health risks, especially to children who play outside. It makes our streets and walkways unhygienic, damages the reputation of our neighbourhood, and creates an environment where people feel disregarded by those who are unwilling to act responsibly. Residents have waited a long time for this issue to be addressed. We urgently ask the council to take stronger action, such as increased signage, patrols, fines, or community awareness campaigns, to ensure that those who neglect their responsibilities are held accountable. We would greatly appreciate your support in tackling this matter, so Kidbrooke can once again be a clean, safe, and welcoming place for everyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Terrace, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter everywhere, 1st October
item.description:
From dirty nappies again and general house waste strewn across the lawns
